description: Demolition of existing building and erection of a part four storey part five storey building incorporating 13 residential units and A1 (retail) use on ground floor with associated bins & bike storage and storage area
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Details of the materials and finishes to be used for all external surfaces (including hardstanding and boundary treatments) of the development hereby approved shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before any part of the development other than works of demolition is commenced and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials and finishes are of high quality and contribute positively to the visual amenity of the locality in accordance with policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2(h), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage, in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards, has been provided in an accessible location for flats and have been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, policy 7B of the Adopted Ealing Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policies 7.4, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| Provision for cycle storage in accordance with adopted standards shall be provided prior to occupation of the units and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016).
| The development hereby approved shall comply with 'Secured by Design' standards.

Reason: To ensure that the development incorporates crime prevention measures to help prevent crime and disorder and to improve pedestrian accessibility in accordance with policies1.1 (e)(h) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7.3 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policy 7.3 of the London Plan (2016).

| The development shall ensure that mitigation measures provided in the proposed residential units shall comply with an acoustic standard of NR 25 Leq 5 mins, (octaves) will be met inside bedrooms and NR 30 Leq,5 mins (octaves) inside living rooms when measured against the noise generated by road traffic and persons on The Broadway. The insulation shall include anti-vibration isolation of the residential units and alternative means of ventilation shall be provided for the residential units whereby the windows can remain closed. These measures shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any residential units and thereafter permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with the Adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) policy 7A, the Ealing Core Strategy (2012) policy 1.1(j), and policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| No development approved by this planning permission shall be commenced until:

a) A desktop study has been carried out which shall include the identification of previous site uses, potential contaminants that might reasonably be expected given those uses and other relevant information.  And using this information a diagrammatical representation (Conceptual Model) for the site of all potential contaminant sources, pathways and receptors has been produced.

b) A site investigation has been designed for the site using the information obtained from the desktop study and any diagrammatical representations (Conceptual Model).  This should be submitted to, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to that investigation being carried out on the site.  The investigation must be comprehensive enough to enable: - a risk assessment to be undertaken relating to groundwater and surface waters associated on and off the site that may be affected, and - refinement of the Conceptual Model, and - the development of a Method Statement detailing the remediation requirements.
c) The site investigation has been undertaken in accordance with details approved by the Local Planning Authority and a risk assessment has been undertaken.

d) A Method Statement detailing the remediation requirements, including measures to minimise the impact on ground and surface waters, using the information obtained from the Site Investigation has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority.  This should be approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to that remediation being carried out on the site.
Reason: To ensure that the proposed site investigations and remediation will not cause pollution of Controlled Waters.

| A delivery and servicing plan (DSP) for the retail element of the development detailing servicing arrangements, times and frequency and operational details, including swept path analysis, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the development. The servicing of the development shall be operated strictly in accordance with the details so approved, shall be maintained as such thereafter and no change therefrom shall take place without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To ensure that the resulting servicing arrangements are satisfactory in terms of their impact on highway safety and the free-flow of traffic in accordance with policies: 6.7 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2016.

| Details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority for a ventilation system to provide fresh air to habitable rooms on the Broadway elevation of the development, the air intake(s) to be located at the rear of the units concerned. The ventilation system(s) provided shall be of suitable acoustic performance to enable the required internal noise standards to be met.  The details approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the dwellings and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority prior to occupation to demonstrate that the development complies with the 'air quality neutral' Building Emissions Benchmark for the proposed C3 use at Appendix 5 of the Sustainable Design and Construction (2014) Supplementary Planning Guidance, London Plan 2011.

Reason: In the interests of improving air quality in the Borough, in accordance with policies policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) and Appendix 5 of the Sustainable Design and Construction (2014) Supplementary Planning Guidance, London Plan 2016.

| Prior to the commencement of development other than works of demolition, details shall be submitted for approval to the Local Planning Authority of noise mitigation measures, with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided, to insulate the dwellings against the transmission of externally generated road traffic and aircraft noise, to meet the minimum internal ambient noise criteria as specified at Figure 2 to "ProPG: Planning & Noise" (May 2017); Living Rooms, Bedrooms = 35 dB LAeq,16 hours ; Kitchens, Dining Rooms, Bathrooms = 40 dB LAeq,16 hours during day-time hours (07:00 - 23:00); and Bedrooms = 30 dB LAeq,8 hours and 45 dB LAmax,F during night-time hours (23:00 - 07:00). The mitigation measures shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the dwellings and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Prior to the commencement of development other than works of demolition, details shall be submitted for approval to the Local Planning Authority of measures to provide mitigation of noise impacts to the proposed amenity spaces to the first floor level accommodation on the Broadway façade of the development.  The mitigation measures shall be designed to achieve the lowest practicable noise levels within the amenity spaces and shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the dwellings and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Prior to the commencement of development other than works of demolition, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, of the sound insulation of the floor/ceiling/walls separating the commercial part(s) of the premises from dwellings.  Details shall demonstrate that the sound insulation value DnT,w + Ctr is enhanced by at least 10-15dB above the Building Regulations value and, where necessary, additional mitigation measures are implemented to contain commercial noise within the commercial premises and to achieve the criteria at Figure 2 of "ProPG: Planning & Noise" (May 2017) within the dwellings.  Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Prior to commencement of construction and demolition works, details of dust and noise/vibration mitigation measures, by way of a demolition and construction management plan, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.  The information submitted should directly cross-reference with the Best Practicable Means and mitigation measures as detailed in the following guidance:  a) The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition, SPG, GLA, July 2014 , b) BS 5228-1:2009 +A1:2014 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.

Reason:  To protect the amenity of neighbouring occupiers, to ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies 1.1(e)(j) and 2.1(c) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.3, 6.13, 7.13, 7.14 and 7.15  of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.

| All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) to be used in the development site shall meet as a minimum the Stage IIIB emission criteria of Directive 97/68/EC and its subsequent amendments, unless it can be demonstrated that Stage IIIB equipment is not available. An inventory of all NRMM shall be registered on the NRMM register at https://nrmm.london/user-nrmm/register. All NRMM shall be regularly serviced and service logs kept on site for inspection. Records shall be kept on site detailing proof of emissions standards for all equipment.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of future occupiers of the site and occupiers of nearby properties, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'.

| Upon the first occupation of the development, the approved development, including residential and non-residential uses, shall incorporate sustainability measures as detailed in the Sustainability Statement (15 September 2016) and additional information (28 November 2017 & 18 January 2018) prepared by Price and Myers.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2016, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.

| Each approved residential unit shall be designed to achieve a water use target for the residential development of no more than 105 litres per person per day, and the non-residential uses shall also incorporate water saving measures and equipment in line with the approved Sustainability Statement (15 September 2016) and supplementary information (28 November 2017 & 18 January 2018) prepared by Price and Myers.
Reason: To ensure the sustainable use of water, in accordance with policy 5.15 of the London Plan 2016.

| All boilers accommodated in the plant room to serve the energy requirements of the development, including space heating and hot water to the dwellings and hot water to the non-domestic spaces, should use Ultra-low NOx boilers with maximum NOx Emissions of under 0.030 g/kWh and be compliant with the NOx (g/m²) benchmarks as set out at Appendix 5 of the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.
The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.14 of The London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Prior to the first occupation of the development (including residential and non-residential components), the approved development shall incorporate and maintain mitigation measures that will assist with reducing the risk of overheating, follow the Cooling Hierarchy and comply with CIBSE TM49 & TM59 criteria as stated in the Thermal Modelling Report for overheating assessment (12 December 2017) and supplementary information (28 November 2017 & 18 January 2018) prepared by Price & Myers.

Reason: To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to reduce the risk of overheating in line with policy 5.9 of the London Plan 2015, adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (3rd April 2012) and Development Management DPD (December 2013).
| Energy Strategy for residential

A) Prior to commencement of the development, other than site preparation, works of demolition, remediation and / or the formation of accesses, evidence of communication with Green Man Lane (GML) development to establish if connection of the proposed development to GML energy centre is feasible and viable shall be submitted to the Local Authority for written approval. If the evidence with GML development proves that connection is feasible and viable, a revised energy report superseding the approved one (January 2018) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval. The revised energy report shall demonstrate measures that will facilitate the connection of the development to the GML energy centre.

B) Within three-months of the practical completion of each residential unit, Energy Performance Certificates and detailed modelling output reports for each unit showing clearly the DER/TER from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

C) Within three-months of the practical completion of each residential unit, evidence that the renewable/low carbon technologies, if incorporated, are certified under the Microgeneration Certification Scheme (MSC) and, if appropriate, complies with the Enhanced Capital Allowances (ECS) product criteria should be submitted.

D) Prior to the final completion of the residential units within the development, the approved dwellings shall incorporate and maintain measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 61.60% (equal to 9.39 tonnesCO2/yr) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the approved Energy Strategy Report (23 January 2018) and supplementary information (28 November 2017 & 18 January 2018) prepared by Price and Myers:

i.	passive design measures to achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 0.21 tonnes CO2 equating to 1.35% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the compliant BR Part L 2013 base case.
ii.	improved energy saving measures to achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 1.76 tonnes CO2 equating to 11.5% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the Be Lean case

iii.	installation of solar Photovoltaic system of at least 23.25kWp capacity/ c.117.49m2 to provide at least 14.3MWh/yr of electricity per annum and achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 7.42 tonnes CO2 equating to at least 50% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the Be Clean case.

E) Measures to reduce the carbon dioxide emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by Building Regulations (un-regulated) shall be in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy Report (23 January 2018) and supplementary information (28 November 2017 & 18 January 2018) prepared by Price and Myers.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.

Reason:  To ensure that each residential unit within the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.
| Energy Strategy for non-residential units

A) Within three-months of the practical completion of the non-residential unit, Energy Performance Certificates and detailed modelling output reports for this unit showing clearly the BER/TER from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

B) Prior to occupation of the non-residential unit, evidence that the renewable/low carbon technologies, if incorporated, are certified under the Microgeneration Certification Scheme (MSC) and, if appropriate, complies with the Enhanced Capital Allowances (ECS) product criteria should be submitted.

C) Prior to the final completion of the non-residential unit contained within the development, the approved spaces shall incorporate and maintain measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 3.43% (equal to 0.18 tonnesCO2/yr) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the approved Energy Strategy Report (23 January 2018) and supplementary information (28 November 2017 & 18 January 2018) prepared by Price and Myers:

i.	Passive design measures to achieve to achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 0.06 tonnes CO2 equating to 1.13% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the compliant BR Part L 2013 base case.
ii.	improved energy saving measures to achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 0.12 tonnes CO2 equating to 2.3% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the Be Lean case

D) Measures to reduce the carbon dioxide emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by Building Regulations (un-regulated) shall be shall be in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy Report (23 January 2018) and supplementary information (28 November 2017 & 18 January 2018) prepared by Price and Myers.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.

Reason:  To ensure that the non-residential unit within the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.
